titleStmt.title: Warren Parker to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4860

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency Thos E Bramlette, Governor of the State of Kentucky;

Your Petitioner would most humbly and respectfully State and Say that at the June 1863 term of the Franklin Circuit Court he was fined in the Sum of $60, Sixty Dollars upon the charge of selling Whiskey without license, contrary to the laws of this State, Your petitioner would and does most solemly aver that he was at the time of the trial of said ^charge^ confined to his bed at home suffering as he then believed with his death illness) severe Heamorage from the lungs (and from which he has never yet entirely recovered) & that he was therefore proceeded against & fined without being able to be present or attempt to make a defense which he believe he could have done but for illness, as your petitioner is a feeble though candid man he would further state and say that he did at several barbacues Sell Blackberry wine of his own manufacture which he believed he had a right to do; but he does positively state that on no occassion did he vend ardent spirits as charged

Therefore your Petitioner throws himself into the arms of Executive clemency and asks that said fine be remited he is a poor man, in feeble health, a large family entirely dependent on him for support_ and that he is unable to pay said fine without great privation to his wife & children.

Warren Parker
Peaks Mill Precinct Franklin Co Ky
April 23 1864

Subscribed and sworn to before me a Justice of the Peace in & for Franklin County Ky May 14th 1864
John R Graham P. J. C. F.

James Sullivan
Edmund F Bacon
Hampton
Frank mose
L K Davidson
Phillip Mefford
Zachariah Megan
M H Christopher
Jacob Boots
J L Dailey

H I Todd
W Franklin
Jno. A. Crittenden
Sanford Goins

Franklin Cir Ct
vs
Warren Parker
$60
Tipling
14th May/64

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
